Title: Proposition 51
Subject: Education
Description: Authorizes issuance and sale of $9 billion in bonds for education and schools

Title: Proposition 52
Subject: Healthcare
Description: Requires voter approval of changes to the hospital fee program

Title: Proposition 53
Subject: Elections and campaigns
Description: Requires voter approval for projects that cost more than $2 billion funded by revenue bonds

Title: Proposition 54
Subject: Government accountability
Description: Prohibits the legislature from passing any bill until it has been in print and published on the Internet for 72 hours prior to the vote

Title: Proposition 55
Subject: Taxes
Description: Extends the temporary personal income tax increases on incomes over $250,000 implemented by Proposition 30

Title: Proposition 56
Subject: Tobacco
Description: Increases the cigarette tax to $2.00 per pack

Title: Proposition 57
Subject: Civil and criminal trials
Description: Increases parole chances for felons convicted of non-violent crimes and give them more opportunities to earn credits for good behavior

Title: Proposition 58
Subject: Education
Description: Repeals Prop 227 of 1998, thus allowing for bilingual education in public schools

Title: Proposition 59
Subject: Campaign finance and Federal issues
Description: Indicates whether voters approve of California State Legislators using what influence they have over federal issues to overturn Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission and "to make clear that corporations should not have the same constitutional rights as human beings."

Title: Proposition 60
Subject: Adult entertainment
Description: Requires the use of condoms in all pornographic films featuring sexual intercourse produced in California

Title: Proposition 61
Subject: Healthcare
Description: Prohibits state agencies from paying more for a prescription drug than the lowest price paid for the same drug by the United States Department of Veterans Affairs

Title: Proposition 62
Subject: Death penalty
Description: Repeals the death penalty in the state of California

Title: Proposition 63
Subject: Firearms
Description: Prohibits possession of large capacity ammunition magazines and requires individuals to pass a background check and receive authorization from the Department of Justice in order to purchase ammunition

Title: Proposition 64
Subject: Marijuana
Description: Legalizes marijuana and hemp under state law and enacts certain sales and cultivation taxes

Title: Proposition 65
Subject: Environment
Description: Redirects money collected from the sale of grocery and retail carry-out bags to a special fund administered by the Wildlife Conservation Board

Title: Proposition 66
Subject: Death penalty
Description: Changes procedures governing state court appeals and petitions challenging death penalty convictions and sentences

Title: Proposition 67
Subject: Business reg
Description: Ratifies SB 270, thus prohibiting plastic single-use carryout bags
